page.title: 06Ball Green near Norton
page.content: Ball Green is a small village near to the slightly larger village of Norton. The nearest town is Burslem about three miles away. Burslem is one of the six towns of Stoke-on-Trent. Ball Green is built on a ridge with the River Trent on the east and a brook on the west side. On the same ridge, but further south is the main village of Norton. These two villages though once being completely separate are now joined by the large Norton housing estate. Years ago every job in the village used to be either farming or coal mining but now there are many diffrent jobs. More people work away from Ball Green now. The nearest large mine was Chatterly-Whitfield, but this has been closed and is now a mining museum.
